sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is associative.
message_2:
To find (A Δ B) Δ C, we first need to find A Δ B, which is the symmetric difference between sets A and B. The symmetric difference between two sets is the set of elements which are in either of the sets but not in both. 

A Δ B = (A ∪ B) - (A ∩ B)

A ∪ B = {1, 3, 5, 7, 6, 9} (union of A and B)
A ∩ B = {3, 7} (intersection of A and B)

A Δ B = {1, 5, 6, 9} (subtracting the intersection from the union)

Now, we need to find (A Δ B) Δ C:

(A Δ B) Δ C = (A Δ B ∪ C) - (A Δ B ∩ C)

A Δ B ∪ C = {1, 5, 6, 9, 2, 3, 4} (union of A Δ B and C)
A Δ B ∩ C = {1} (intersection of A Δ B and C)

(A Δ B) Δ C = {5, 6, 9, 2, 3, 4} (subtracting the intersection from the union)

So, (A Δ B) Δ C = {5, 6, 9, 2, 3, 4}.
